title: Aliza Vellani
text:
Aliza Vellani (born October 30, 1991) is a <a href="Canadians">Canadian</a> television actress based in <a href="Vancouver">British Columbia</a>. Vellani is most recently known for her role as Rani Singh in the <a href="Netflix">Netflix</a> series, <a href="Sweet%20Tooth%20%28TV%20series%29">Sweet Tooth</a>. Many of her other credits include Layla Siddiqui on <a href="Canadian%20Broadcasting%20Corporation">CBC's</a> series "<a href="Little%20Mosque%20on%20the%20Prairie">Little Mosque on the Prairie</a>", Marcy in the CW series "<a href="iZombie%20%28TV%20series%29">iZombie</a>" and Sandeep in the revival season of the <a href="Fox%20Broadcasting%20Company">Fox</a> series "<a href="The%20X-Files%20%28season%2010%29">The X-Files</a>".
Early life and education.
Vellani was born in <a href="Vancouver">Vancouver</a> to <a href="India">India</a>n immigrants from <a href="East%20Africa">East Africa</a>. She began her training at an early age while she attended <a href="York%20House%20School">York House School</a>. In 2007 and 2008, Vellani won the BC and National Istar Awards for Arts and Culture.After high school, Vellani continued her training in acting, voice and dance. Vellani currently holds a BFA, Majoring in Theatre, at <a href="Simon%20Fraser%20University">Simon Fraser University</a>.
